messages.subject: what freedom of speech is (was "Ned, censorship, list manners")
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/03 5:30:55 PM, FoxgloveStudio@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/03 5:30:55 PM, FoxgloveStudio@... writes:

<< I guess I'm just spoiled by that silly little
so-called right called "Freedom of Speech." >>

Too bad you don't understand it, and I guess you're not reading my posts
where I'm calmly and repeatedly saying that your freedom of speech involves
you in the U.S., not you on other people's lists, in their newspapers, on
their TV shows, etc.

<<I suppose if the site had been
named something like Helen's House Party. Com or Sandra and her pals.com or
OnlyOne Vision of UnSchooling.Com, I would never have tried.>>

If you have a list, not matter what you call it it will be, in actuality,
Foxglove's House Party and you can throw others out if you want to. If you
have described to your pals who join your list what you intend to have the
list be, you will pretty much have a duty to them to throw people out who are
going to mess up the vision you have for your list, if they ignore your
repeated requests to keep to your chosen topic and tone.

Sandra
